localeCode.description:
Locale code for language that appears in text and descriptions on the site, for example, en_US. 
This is not the currency code. Currently only en_US is supported.

purchaseLocation.description:
The location where the product is being purchased.. default is null. Products can have different prices
by purchaseLocation via custom priceListResolution...

lineId.description:
The line id assigned to the order item. Visible only in the Admin, this is set from the Admin or
in CommerceRuntime when a cart is converted to an order.

isRecurring.description: If true, the cart item lists a product that can be purchased or fulfilled at regular intervals, for example, monthly billing or a subscription.

isTaxable.description: Not implemented. If true, the cart item is eligible for tax.

subtotal.description: Line item subtotal (quantity multiplied by price) before discounts.

extendedTotal.description: Line item extended total (quantity multiplied by unit extended price) before discounts.

taxableTotal.description: Line item subtotal (quantity multiplied by price) before discounts.

discountTotal.description: How much the shopper saves with the applied discount or sale price. This is a negative number.

itemTaxTotal.description: Total price of taxes that apply to products in this item.

shippingTaxTotal.description: Total price of taxes that apply to the shipping of this item.

shippingTotal.description: Total price of shipping that apply to this item.

feeTotal.description: Not implemented. Total cost of fees that apply to this item.

total.description: Total price of this cart item taking into account any discounts.

productDiscounts.description: A list of discounts applied to the product

shippingDiscounts.description: A discount applied to the shipping

data.description: Custom data for a given vendor set within the commerce process.

taxData.description: Storage for any additional/custom tax data.

shippingAmountBeforeDiscountsAndAdjustme.description: Shipping amount before Discounts and adjustments

weightedOrderAdjustment.description: Order Level Manual Adjustment applied to this Item

weightedOrderDiscount.description: Order Level Discount applied to this Item

totalWithoutWeightedShippingAndHandling.description: Taxable Subtotal including Weighted Order amounts

weightedOrderTax.description: Order Level tax applied to this Item

weightedOrderShipping.description: Order Level Shipping applied to this Item

weightedOrderShippingDiscount.description: Order Level Shipping discount applied to this Item

weightedOrderShippingManualAdjustment.description: Order Level Shipping Manual Adjustment applied to this Item

weightedOrderShippingTax.description: Order Level Shipping Tax applied to this Item

weightedOrderHandlingFee.description: Order Level handling fee applied to this item

weightedOrderHandlingFeeTax.description: Order Level handling fee tax applied to this item

weightedOrderHandlingFeeDiscount.description: Order Level handling fee discount applied to this item

weightedOrderDuty.description: Order Level Duty applied to this Item

totalWithWeightedShippingAndHandling.description: Line item total with line item, Tax, Weighted Tax with Weighted shipping and handling costs

weightedOrderHandlingAdjustment.description: Order level handling adjusment that applies to this item.

autoAddDiscountId.description: Track the discoutid from which the item was auto added

isAssemblyRequired.description: Assembly Required for this order item

childItemIds.description: List of Child Item Ids for this order item

parentItemId.description: Indicates Parent Item Id for this order item

CommerceItem.description: Base class for cart and order items

enabled.description: Indicates if the trial is enabled

substituteProductCode.description: Product code to substitute once the trial period is finished.

substituteVariationProductCode.description: Variation product code to substitute once the trial period is finished.

substituteProductOptions.description: Configurable Options to substitute once the trial period is finished.

required.description: Indicates commerce item is subscribed or not.

id.description: Unique identifier of the item in the cart.

fulfillmentLocationCode.description: Location code from which to obtain this item

fulfillmentMethod.description: Fulfillment method used to fulfill this item

CartItem.description: Details of an item in the shopper's cart, such as the product name, stock count, unit price, discounts, quantity ordered, and total price.

reasonCode.description: Code that identifies the reason the coupon was invalid.

createDate.description: Create date of the invalid coupon.

InvalidCoupon.description: Represents a coupon that is considered invalid by the Mozu pricing service.

items.description: List of items in the cart.

couponCodes.description: Coupon codes associated with this order.  Only set on order import.

invalidCoupons.description: A list of invalid coupons that were attempted on the cart

handlingAmount.description: Order level handling fees excluding any discounts.

handlingSubTotal.description: Handling fees for the Order as well as CartItems (e.g. if the Cart has a $5 handling fee and an CartItem has a $2 handling fee per item quantity and the quantity of items is 2 then the value in this property would be $9)

Cart.description:
Details of the current cart, including shopper's user ID, items listed in the cart, and any system messages. 
For each item, contains the list of available discounts and the actual discount applied to the cart item.

CartItemCollection.description: Collection of items in the cart. A collection is not paged.

CartChangeMessageCollection.description: Collection of cart messages returned as a whole. A collection is not paged.

code.description: Code to uniquely identify the channel.

name.description: Friendly name of the channel.

groupCode.description: Code to uniquely identify the channel group, if any that contains this channel.

siteIds.description: A list of site Id's that this channel contains.

Channel.description: Channel used to group sites for commerce purposes.

code.description: Code to uniquely identify the channel.

name.description: Friendly name of the channel.

ChannelGroup.description: Used to group channels together to manage common channel information.

id.description: Unique identifier of the order line item. System-supplied and read-only.

destinationId.description: The destination associated with this item when used with a multi-ship checkout.

originalCartItemId.description:
Unique identifier of the cart item that is associated with this line item. 
(This is the original Cart Item ID expressed as a GUID.)

fulfillmentLocationCode.description: Location code from which to obtain this item

fulfillmentMethod.description: Fulfillment method used to fulfill this item

dutyAmount.description: Duty or Tariff for this item

CommerceRuntimeOrderItem.description: A single line item of an order.

id.description: A unique identifier for this grouping.

destinationId.description: The DestinationId used by items in this grouping, which may be {null}.

fulfillmentMethod.description: The FulfillmentMethod used by items in this grouping.

orderItemIds.description: Identifiers of the items that make up this grouping.

shippingMethodCode.description:
Code that uniquely identifies the shipping method such as "Ground," "Overnight," or "Digital."
The site's shipping settings lists the valid shipping methods specified for this site.

shippingMethodName.description: Readable name of the shipping method.

standaloneGroup.description: Indicates whether a non ship group should combine with a ship group

dutyAmount.description: Any duty fee applied directly to this group. Items can also have their own duty fee.

dutyTotal.description: Total raw duty amounts for this group.

shippingAmount.description: If a shipping method applies directly to this grouping (versus the items), this is the raw shipping amount for the group.

shippingSubTotal.description: The raw shipping amount minus shipping discounts.

itemLevelShippingDiscountTotal.description: The total value of item-level shipping discounts applied to this group.

orderLevelShippingDiscountTotal.description: The total value of order-level (group-level) shipping discounts applied to this group.

shippingTax.description: Group-level shipping tax. Does not account for item shipping tax.

shippingTaxTotal.description: The total shipping tax for this group, accounting for both group-level and item-level shipping tax.

shippingTotal.description: The total shipping cost for this group, accounting for discounts and tax.

handlingAmount.description: The handling fee amount that's applicable to this grouping.

handlingSubTotal.description: The total raw handling amounts minus handling discounts.

itemLevelHandlingDiscountTotal.description: The total value of item-level handling discounts applied to this group.

orderLevelHandlingDiscountTotal.description: The total value of order-level (group-level) handling discounts applied to this group.

handlingTax.description: Group-level handling tax. Does not account for item handling tax.

handlingTaxTotal.description: The total handling tax for this group, accounting for both group-level and item-level handling tax.

handlingTotal.description: The total handling cost for this group, accounting for discounts and tax.

id.description: An identifier for this entry.

isDestinationCommercial.description: Indicates that the destination is commercial

targetType.description: Specifies if the Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Payments.PaymentActionTarget.TargetId is a Checkout Id, Order Id, or Return Id.

targetId.description: The Id of the Checkout/Order/Return to target.

targetNumber.description: The number of the Checkout/Order/Return to target.

paymentOrCardType.description: Card type such as Visa, MasterCard, American Express, or Discover.

cardNumberPartOrMask.description:
The visible part of the card number that the merchant uses to refer to 
payment information, for example, the last for digits of the card number.

isUsedRecurring.description: If true, the credit card is charged on a regular interval, such as for a subscription. (Not supported currently.)

nameOnCard.description: Card holder's name as it appears on the card.

isCardInfoSaved.description: If true, the card information is stored in the customer's account.

isTokenized.description: If true, the card is tokenized by external provider

ccLastFour.description:
Last four digit of Credit card
Only for OMS Only tenant.

PaymentCard.description:
If the customer is paying by credit card, the card holder's details, such as the name on the card, number, billing 
address, and expiration dates.

paymentType.description:
Type of payment, such as credit card, check by mail, or PayPal.
see Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Payments.PaymentTypeConst for valid values

isSameBillingShippingAddress.description: Indicates that billing and shipping address are the same

storeCreditCode.description: The store credit to use for this purchase

storeCreditType.description: The type of store credit used for this purchase

customCreditType.description: Name of custom stored credit type

externalTransactionId.description: Transaction Id from third party payment source like Visa Checkout, Amazon

isRecurring.description: Indicates whether the payment is used in recurring transactions. ex- subscription payments

recurringTransactionId.description:
Recurring Payment Id returned by Payment Gateway
networkTransactionId for vantiv
previousTransactionId for cybersource etc

BillingInfo.description:
Customer's payment details such as payment type (credit card, check by mail, or PayPal)
and cardholder information if payment is by credit card.

shipmentNumber.description: The identifying number of the shipment affected by the payment action

shipmentTotal.description: The shipment's total when the payment action occurred

amountApplied.description: The amount applied by the payment action

id.description: Unique identifier of this payment transaction interaction.

gatewayInteractionId.description:
Unique identifier of the gateway interaction. Used for credit card transactions, where the
payment service creates a GatewayInteractionId for each transaction interaction.

paymentId.description: Unique identifier of the original transaction of which this current interaction is a part.

orderId.description: Unique identifier of the order with which this transaction is associated.

currencyCode.description: ISO currency code for the transaction. Currently, only USD is supported.

interactionType.description:
Types of transaction interactions which can be "Authorization," "Capture," "AuthorizeAndCapture,"
"Void," or "Credit," "CheckRequested," or "CheckReceived."

checkNumber.description: If paying by check, the check number.

status.description: Status of the payment transaction interaction which can be either "Success" or "Failure."

paymentEntryStatus.description: Status of the payment when the transaction interaction was created

isRecurring.description: If true, the product is purchased or fulfilled at regular intervals, for example, a monthly billing or a subscription. (Not currently implemented.)

isManual.description: If the payment is a manual payment, this is set to true

gatewayTransactionId.description: Unique identifier of the transaction supplied by PCIaaS.

gatewayAuthCode.description: If required by the payment gateway, the authorization code of the transaction. Supplied by PCIaaS.

gatewayAVSCodes.description: Gateway AVS Codes. Supplied by PCIaaS.

gatewayCVV2Codes.description: Gateway CVV2 Codes. Supplied by PCIaaS.

gatewayResponseCode.description: Gateway response code. Supplied by PCIaaS.

gatewayResponseText.description: Gateway response text. Supplied by PCIaaS.

gatewayResponseData.description: A List of payment response data required to act on authorization when using external order management systems

paymentTransactionInteractionIdReference.description:
Unique identifier of previous PaymentTransactionInteraction that this PaymentTransactionInteraction is modifying.
For instance, when crediting a capture, set the PaymentTransactionInteractionIdReference to the capture PaymentTransactionInteractionID.

amount.description: Amount of funds associated with this interaction.

note.description: Note to be entered by merchant/application

returnId.description: Return Id, if the interaction is a Credit for a return-refund.

refundId.description: Refund Id, if the interaction is for a stand alone refund.

capturableShipmentsSummary.description: Stores pairings of shipment number to shipment total for all captured shipments. This was added for generating TLogs.

PaymentInteraction.description:
A single interaction of a potential list of intereactions for a transaction. The scope of the transaction is the entire payment
interchange. It is created upon authorization and is used for all subsequent interactions performed against the authorize,
such as consecutive captures.

id.description: Unique identifier of this order transaction.

paymentServiceTransactionId.description: Unique identifier of the transaction, specified by the payment service processesing this transaction.

orderId.description: Unique identifier of the order with which this transaction is associated.

paymentWorkflow.description: The source of data for this payment.  By default, this will be set to 'mozu'

externalTransactionId.description: The external/third party transaction Id for this payment. This is used to store the transaction Id from digital wallet like Visa Checkout

status.description: Current status of this transaction which are described by the PaymentStatusConst class.

subPayments.description: List of sub payments that correspond to child orders in case of multiship orders.

interactions.description:
List of intereactions for this transaction. A transaction is created upon authorization and lasts across the payment 
interchange, which can consist of multiple interactions, such as consecutive captures.

isRecurring.description:
If true, the product is purchased or fulfilled at regular intervals, for example, 
monthly billing or a subscription. (Not currently supported.)

amountCredited.description: Amount credited back to the payment.

amountRequested.description:
Derived from the Amount on the initial payment create, used to help storefront determine how much can be captured for multiple payments.
See Order.AmountRemainingForPayment for an example.

changeMessages.description: Change messages related to the payment.

Payment.description:
Payment transaction associated with this order. It is the entire payment interchange between the merchant who is forwarding the customer's payment 
information and the payment service who is authorizing and capturing payment. Payment can be either by credit card, check, or PayPal. (PayPal not
currently supported.)

firstName.description: First Name of alternate contact during order process

lastNameOrSurname.description: Last Name of alternate contact during order process

emailAddress.description: Email Address of alternate contact during order process

phoneNumber.description: Phone Number of alternate contact during order process

giftMessage.description: Gift message associated with this order.

CommerceRuntimeShopperNotes.description: Notes that the shopper has added to this order, for example, a gift message or other comments.

id.description: Unique identifier.

number.description: A checkout number that is only assigned after the checkout is placed.

originalCartId.description: Unique identifier for the cart that was converted to checkout.

submittedDate.description: When the customer placed (submitted) the order.

type.description: Is this Order Online or Offline? Online means shopper entered at checkout, offline means a phone order.

items.description: List of items in the checkout.

payments.description:
Payment transaction associated with this checkout. It is the entire payment interchange between the merchant 
who is forwarding the customer's payment information and the payment service who is authorizing and 
capturing payment. Payment can be either by credit card, check, or PayPal.

amountRemainingForPayment.description:
A counter for how much of the total has not been claimed by payments.
This is computed by Total - (sum of Payments where State is not Voided/Declined)

customerAccountId.description: Unique identifier of the customer account.

customerTaxId.description: The customers tax ID. If Customer Account ID exists in the system, will set this.

isTaxExempt.description: Unique identifier of the customer account.

data.description: Custom data for a given vendor set within the commerce process.

taxData.description: Storage for any additional/custom tax data.

channelCode.description: Unique identifier of the channel for this item.

locationCode.description: Identifies the location at which the order was placed if the order was placed externally.

ipAddress.description: IP address of the user placing the order. (User or customer?)

sourceDevice.description: Source device of the user placing the order. (User or customer?)

visitId.description: Identifies the Visit ID that was current when the order was placed or when the cart was last updated.

webSessionId.description: Identifies the web session used to place the order or last update the cart.

customerInteractionType.description:
Determines the interaction type that a customer will use to create this object.
Valid values are: Website, Store, Call, Unknown

couponCodes.description: Coupon codes associated with this order.

invalidCoupons.description: A list of invalid coupons that were attempted on the order.

discountThresholdMessages.description: List of Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Commerce.ThresholdMessage objects that are valid for the current value of the cart/order.

subTotal.description: Subtotal before any coupon codes, taxes, fees, etc.

itemLevelProductDiscountTotal.description: The total value of item-level product discounts.

orderLevelProductDiscountTotal.description: The total value of order-level (group-level) product discounts.

itemTotal.description: The total product cost, accounting for discounts and tax.

shippingSubTotal.description: Shipping does not appear on cart.

itemLevelShippingDiscountTotal.description: The total value of item-level shipping discounts.

orderLevelShippingDiscountTotal.description: The total value of order-level (group-level) shipping discounts.

shippingTotal.description: Overall shipping total, accounting for item and order-level shipping costs, any shipping discounts, and shipping tax.

handlingSubTotal.description:
Pre-Discounted Handling Subtotal of the CommerceAggregate and its Items.
Returns {null} if the calculated value is negative.

itemLevelHandlingDiscountTotal.description: The total value of item-level handling discounts.

orderLevelHandlingDiscountTotal.description: The total value of order-level (group-level) handling discounts.

handlingTotal.description: Overall handling total, accounting for line and order-level handling costs, any handling discounts, and handling tax.

currencyCode.description: ISO currency code such as US dollars. Currently, only USD is supported.

price.description: How much the customer pays for shipping which includes any shipping discounts that the merchant offers.

ShippingPrice.description: Shipping pricing information which includes the cost to the merchant and the price that the customer pays.

shippingMethodCode.description: Code that uniquely identifies the selected shipping method.

shippingZoneCode.description: The shipping zone to which this rate applies.

isValid.description: If true, the shipping rate is valid.

messages.description: Messages and detail about why the shipping rate may be invalid.

data.description: Custom data returned by the shipping service.

CommerceRuntimeShippingRate.description:
How much the customer and merchant pay for shipping based on the current shipping rate. 
The cost can differ between the merchant and customer depending on any merchant discounts or 
extra fees.

digitalWalletData.description:
Digital wallet data.
Note: Transform the Json data to a string.

cartId.description:
Cart ID
Note: This property should only be set if the order is not created and user opted to 
create the order from cart using digital wallet.

gatewayInteractionId.description: Gateway Transaction Id from PCIaaS.  Not populated by incoming request.

gatewayTransactionId.description: Gateway Transaction Id from PCIaaS.  Not populated by incoming request.

gatewayAuthCode.description: Gateway Transaction Id from PCIaaS.  Not populated by incoming request.

gatewayResponseText.description: Gateway response text. Supplied by PCIaaS.

PaymentGatewayInteraction.description: Represents a manually entered payment gateway interaction.

actionName.description: Name of the Action to post

currencyCode.description: ISO currency code for the transaction. Currently, only USD is supported.

checkNumber.description: If paying by check, the check number.

returnUrl.description: If paying by Paypal Express or some other potential non-gateway payment provider, a return redirect URL must be provided.

cancelUrl.description:
If paying by Paypal Express or some other potential non-gateway payment provider, a cancel redirect URL must be provided.
This will be used if something goes wrong on the third-party side.

amount.description: Amount of funds to withdraw to pay for this order.

referenceSourcePaymentId.description: Reference payment id from which to copy the billing info.

productCode.description: Code of the Product to be fulfilled.

lineId.description: The line id associated with the fulfillment.

PackageItem.description: An item in a package representing a particular product.

id.description: ID of the fulfillment unit.

code.description:
A human-readable identifier for this fulfillment unit.  If not set on create, will be autogenerated as a string of the form
    {fulfillmentUnitType} #{next available int}

status.description:
Status of the fulfillment unit
See FulfillmentStatusConst

items.description: List of items in the fulfillment unit

fulfillmentLocationCode.description: Location code from which to obtain this item

availableActions.description: Actions that can be taken on this fulfillment unit

changeMessages.description: Change messages related to the fulfillment unit.

trackingNumber.description: Tracking number of this package (to support classic use cases)

hasLabel.description: If there is a shipping label present for this Package, this will be set to true

trackings.description: Tracking number and url data for this package

CommerceRuntimePackage.description: Describes a package that will be shipped to somebody

id.description: Unique identifier of the note. System-supplied and read-only.

text.description: Text of the note. Maximum 250 characters.

OrderNote.description: Internal notes that a merchant may add to the order. Maximum 250 characters.

orderItemId.description: Order item id that this message applies to.  Can be empty.

messageType.description: Identifier to indicate the type of the message, See OrderValidatorMessageTypeConst for options.

message.description: Actual message returned by the validator.

OrderValidationMessage.description: Validation message returned by an order validator.

validationId.description: Identifier set by the capability that states the id of this specific validation attempt

validatorName.description: Identifier set by the capability that states the specific name of this validator.

validatorType.description: Identifies the type of the validator (types are enumerated in OrderValidatorTypeConst)

status.description: Status of the order validation result.  See OrderValidatorStatusConst for options.

createdDate.description: DateTime that this validation result was created

messages.description: Messages returned by the order validator

OrderValidationResult.description: The result of an order validator.

id.description: Unique identifier of this order transaction.

orderId.description: Unique identifier of the order with which this refund is associated.

Refund.description:
Refund associated with an order. A refund is a single exchange of money from merchant to customer
that either encapsulates a refund to a credit card or an issuance of a store credit.
A refund does not reduce the 'amount collected' on an order and it is possible for a refund to exceed the total order amount.

id.description: Unique identifier of this order transaction.

parentPaymentId.description: The paymentid of the Parent Payment associated with this Credit (if applicable).

CommerceRuntimePickupItem.description: Item that goes into the pickup to determine which items will be picked up.

id.description: ID of the fulfillment unit.

code.description:
A human-readable identifier for this fulfillment unit.  If not set on create, will be autogenerated as a string of the form
    {fulfillmentUnitType} #{next available int}

status.description:
Status of the fulfillment unit
See FulfillmentStatusConst

items.description: List of items in the fulfillment unit

fulfillmentLocationCode.description: Location code from which to obtain this item

availableActions.description: Actions that can be taken on this fulfillment unit

changeMessages.description: Change messages related to the fulfillment unit.

Pickup.description: Represents a pickup by a customer from a merchant.

id.description: ID of the fulfillment unit.

code.description:
A human-readable identifier for this fulfillment unit.  If not set on create, will be autogenerated as a string of the form
    {fulfillmentUnitType} #{next available int}

status.description:
Status of the fulfillment unit
See FulfillmentStatusConst

items.description: List of items in the fulfillment unit

fulfillmentLocationCode.description: Location code from which to obtain this item

availableActions.description: Actions that can be taken on this fulfillment unit

changeMessages.description: Change messages related to the fulfillment unit.

firstName.description: First Name of alternate contact during order process

lastNameOrSurname.description: Last Name of alternate contact during order process

email.description: Email Address of alternate contact during order process

phoneNumber.description: Phone Number of alternate contact during order process

id.description: ID of the shipment

orderNumber.description: Order Number. This is an integer that is only assigned after an order is placed and enters the open state.

locationCode.description: Identifies the location at which the order was placed if the order was placed externally.

parentOrderId.description: If this Order has a parent order, this should be the parent's ID.

parentOrderNumber.description: If this order has a parent order, this should be the parent's Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Orders.Order.OrderNumber.

parentCheckoutId.description: If this order originated from a multi-ship enabled site, this is the identifier of the originating checkout.

parentCheckoutNumber.description: If this order originated from a multi-ship enabled site, this is the number of the originating checkout.

partialOrderNumber.description: If this order originated from a checkout, this is a sequence number out of the total orders created from that checkout.

partialOrderCount.description: If this order originated from a checkout, this is the total number of orders created from that checkout.

isPartialOrder.description: Returns {true} if this order originated from a checkout and has sibling partial orders, otherwise {false}.

parentReturnId.description: If this order was created as part of a return, this should be the return's ID.

parentReturnNumber.description: If this order was created as part of a return, this should be the return's ReturnNumber.

originalCartId.description: Unique identifier for the cart that was converted to order.

originalQuoteId.description: If this order originated from a quote, this is the identifier of the originating quote.

originalQuoteNumber.description: If this order originated from a quote, this is the number of the originating quote.

customerAccountId.description: Unique identifier of the customer account.

customerTaxId.description: The customers tax ID.  If Customer Account ID exists in the system, will set this.

isTaxExempt.description: Unique identifier of the customer account.

email.description: Email address of the customer at the time the order is placed.

ipAddress.description: IP address of the user placing the order. (User or customer?)

sourceDevice.description: Source device of the user placing the order. (User or customer?)

status.description: Current status of the order, which can be viewed in OrderStatusConst. System-supplied and read-only.

type.description: Is this Order Online or Offline? Online means shopper entered at checkout, offline means a phone order.

paymentStatus.description:
Current status of payment, which can be "Null," "AwaitingCheck," "AwaitingPayment," "Paid," "Authorized," or "Void." 
System-supplied and read-only.

isEligibleForReturns.description: Marker for determining if the order is a) complete or b) has some items that are shipped and not part of any other return

totalCollected.description: Total amount of money collected on the order via payments.

handlingDiscounts.description: The list of historically-applied handling discounts.  The active one will have IsExcluded == false

handlingAmount.description: Order level handling fees excluding any discounts.

handlingSubTotal.description: Handling fees for the Order as well as OrderItems (e.g. if the Order has a $5 handling fee and an OrderItem has a $2 handling fee per item quantity and the quantity of items is 2 then the value in this property would be $9)

dutyAmount.description: Order level duty or tariff amount. Does not take into account duties or tariffs specifically on items on the order

dutyTotal.description: Duties or tariffs for the Order as well as OrderItems (e.g. if the Order has a $5 duty or tariff for any reason and an OrderItem has a $2 duty or tariff then the value in this property would be $7)

fulfillmentStatus.description:
Current fulfillment status, which can be "NotFulfilled,", "PartiallyFulfilled", or "Fufilled." 
System-supplied and read-only.  Values are available in FulfillmentStatusConst of this class.

isFulfillable.description: Flag to indicate whether it is safe to proceed with fulfillment on shipments on the order.

submittedDate.description: When the customer placed (submitted) the order.

closedDate.description: Date the order was closed. A closed order means that the order has been processed and items shipped.

acceptedDate.description: When the order was accepted by the merchant

notes.description: Internal notes that a merchant may add to the order. Maximum 250 characters.

items.description: List of items in the order.

validationResults.description: Validation results for the order when processes against validation capabilities.

payments.description:
Payment transaction associated with this order. It is the entire payment interchange between the merchant 
who is forwarding the customer's payment information and the payment service who is authorizing and 
capturing payment. Payment can be either by credit card, check, or PayPal.

refunds.description:
Refunds associated with this order. A refund is a single exchange of money from merchant to customer
that either encapsulates a refund to a credit card or an issuance of a store credit.
Refunds does not reduce the 'amount collected' on an order and it is possible for refunds to exceed the total order amount.

packages.description: Shipping package associated with this order.

pickups.description: Fulfillment pickups associated with this order.

digitalPackages.description: Fulfillment digital packages associated with this order.

shipments.description: Package shipments associated with this order.

isDraft.description: Is this order a draft version

hasDraft.description: Does this order have a draft version.

isImport.description: Was this order initiated from an external system

isHistoricalImport.description: Indicates this was an order in a terminal state (completed/canceled) that was imported into the system for historical purposes.

isUnified.description: Was this order created by the Unified platform.

externalId.description: An order number to link this order to an external system

couponCodes.description: Coupon codes associated with this order.  Only set on order import.

invalidCoupons.description: A list of invalid coupons that were attempted on the order

amountAvailableForRefund.description:
This property represents AmountCaptured - AmountRefunded via returns.
It is read only.

amountRemainingForPayment.description:
A counter for how much of the order total has not been claimed by payments.
This is computed by Order.Total-(sum of Order.Payments where State is not voided/declined)

amountRefunded.description:
A counter for how much money has been issued in refunds.
This calculated field does NOT include refunds issued in returns.

isOptInForSms.description: Whether the shopper opts in to curbside text notifications.

subscriptionIds.description: All the subscriptions associated with the current order.

continuityOrderOrdinal.description: The ordinal to track the Continuity order.

productCode.description: The product code of the associated item.

productName.description: The name of the associated product.

shipmentItemId.description: Shipment Item Id Number associated with product

quantityReturned.description: The number if times this item configuration was found in live returns (not cancelled or rejected).

fulfillmentFields.description: List of unique product identifiers for an item on shipment

OrderReturnableItemCollection.description: Collection of fulfillment information for items on an order.

OrderCollection.description:
Paged collection of orders. This is paged in case it's returning a long list the orders. 
for a store.

actionName.description: Name of the fulfillment action to perform

packageIds.description: Ids of packages to mark as fulfilled

pickupIds.description: Ids of pickups to mark as fulfilled

digitalPackageIds.description: Ids of digital packages to mark as fulfilled

FulfillmentAction.description: Action to perform a fulfillment operation on the order.

OrderItemCollection.description: Collection of items listed on the order.

id.description: Unique identifier of the comment. System-supplied and read-only.

QuoteComment.description: Quote Comments submitted by B2B buyer/seller.

name.description: Field/Property name which got Modified.

newValue.description: Newly updated value of the field.

AuditRecordChangeField.description: This will contains actual change in the AuditHistory.

type.description: Indicate type of change like Add, Update, Remove.

path.description:
This will applicable only to the nested objects (Collection) on the quote like Quote Items, Destination contacts.
This field will indicate which item in the collection got modified exactly.
Null path means it's not nested on the quote object.

AuditRecordChange.description: Group all related audit changes into AuditRecordChange.

changes.description: List of changes for this audit history entry.

AuditRecord.description: Group a set of changes made by a single user into a single audit history entry.

id.description: Unique identifier.

name.description: Name of the quote

number.description: Auto generated number that is assigned to the quote when creation.

submittedDate.description: When the customer placed (submitted) the Quote.

items.description: List of items in the Quote.

expirationDate.description:
When the quote will no longer be active. That is, the quote is considered abandoned. 
Date in UTC Date/Time.

customerAccountId.description: Unique identifier of the customer account.

customerTaxId.description: The customers tax ID. If Customer Account ID exists in the system, will set this.

isTaxExempt.description: Unique identifier of the customer account.

data.description: Custom data for a given vendor set within the commerce process.

taxData.description: Storage for any additional/custom tax data.

channelCode.description: Unique identifier of the channel for this item.

locationCode.description: Identifies the location at which the order was placed if the order was placed externally.

ipAddress.description: IP address of the user placing the order. (User or customer?)

sourceDevice.description: Source device of the user placing the order. (User or customer?)

visitId.description: Identifies the Visit ID that was current when the order was placed or when the cart was last updated.

webSessionId.description: Identifies the web session used to place the order or last update the cart.

customerInteractionType.description:
Determines the interaction type that a customer will use to create this object.
Valid values are: Website, Store, Call, Unknown

subTotal.description: Subtotal before any coupon codes, taxes, fees, etc.

itemLevelProductDiscountTotal.description: The total value of item-level product discounts.

orderLevelProductDiscountTotal.description: The total value of order-level (group-level) product discounts.

itemTotal.description: The total product cost, accounting for discounts and tax.

hasDraft.description: Does this quote have a draft

couponCodes.description: Coupon codes associated with this Quote.

invalidCoupons.description: A list of invalid coupons that were attempted on the quote

reason.description: The reason this item has been returned.

quantity.description: The quantity associated with this Reason.

ReturnReason.description: Represents a quantity associated with a given reason for a return

productCode.description: Merchant-created code that uniquely identifies the product.

quantity.description: The amount of this particular product in a bundle that is in this Return

id.description: The identifer of the return

orderItemId.description: The OrderItem that this ReturnItem is associated with. Either the Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.Product or the OrderItemId must be present.

orderLineId.description: The OrderLineId that this ReturnItem is associated with. If Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.OrderItemId is present, the OrderLineId should be present also.

orderItemOptionAttributeFQN.description: If this item refers to a product extra, provide the item's corresponding OptionAttributeFQN.

reasons.description:
For a given return reason (Damaged, Defective, MissingParts, DifferentExpectations, Late, NoLongerWanted, Other),
how many of the above OrderItem are to be replaced.  This value is provided by the Shopper when they request a Return.

excludeProductExtras.description:
If this return item refers to a product/bundle that has product extras, this specifies whether those child items should be included or excluded.
For backward compatibility, a null value will be treated as false, i.e. include the extras.

returnType.description: Specifies whether the requested resolution for this item is Refund or Replace.

returnNotRequired.description:
Specifies whether this item should be returned to the merchant, e.g. if the item is irreparably damaged and it's not worth shipping back.
Even if this is set to true, Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.QuantityShipped should still be set to the quantity of items involved in the return.

quantityReceived.description:
The amount of this item actually received from the shopper. It may differ from the sum of the ReturnReasons.
This is populated by the system when the Receive action is performed.

receiveStatus.description:
Describes the receive status of this item.
If Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.ReturnNotRequired is {true}, then this should be Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.ItemReceiveStatusConst.NOT_REQUESTED.
Otherwise the value should be Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.ItemReceiveStatusConst.RECEIVED or Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.ItemReceiveStatusConst.WAITING depending on Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.QuantityReceived.

quantityShipped.description: The quantity of this item fulfilled on the parent order.

replaceStatus.description:
Describes the replace status of this item.
If Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.ReturnType is Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.Return.ReturnTypeConst.REFUND, then this should be Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.ItemReplaceStatusConst.NOT_REQUESTED.
Otherwise the value should be Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.ItemReplaceStatusConst.REPLACED or Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.ItemReplaceStatusConst.NOT_REPLACED depending on Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.QuantityReplaced.

quantityRestockable.description:
Of the quantity returned, how many of this item can be added back into the inventory? This item is set by the merchant via an UpdateReturn call.
It is used during the Restock action to set some quantity of this item back into the inventory management system.

quantityRestocked.description: Field to specify How many items added to inventory

refundAmount.description: If a refund is issued for the return, how much of the refund amount is for this particular item.

returnProcessingFeeApplied.description: The processing fee on the item that gets persisted into the database

shippingAndHandlingRefunded.description: Determines if shipping and handling is returned on the item

quantityRefunded.description: The quantity of the item being refunded is specified in this field

refundStatus.description:
Describes the refund status of this item.
If Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.ReturnType is Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.Return.ReturnTypeConst.REPLACE, then this should be Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.ItemRefundStatusConst.NOT_REQUESTED.
Otherwise the value should be Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.ItemRefundStatusConst.REFUNDED or Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.ItemRefundStatusConst.NOT_REFUNDED depending on Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.ReturnItem.RefundAmount.

quantityReplaced.description:
Specifies the quantity of this item that has been marked as replaced, i.e. it has been used to generate a replacement order for the return.
Note that the quantity replaced may not line up with the quantity of the item actually sent back to the shopper,
such as in the case of an exchange, e.g. swapping a medium shirt for a large shirt.

notes.description: Any merchant-supplied notes for this ReturnItem.

productLossAmount.description: The loss incurred of the returned products, used for accounting purposes.

productLossTaxAmount.description: The tax on the returned products, used for accounting purposes.

shippingLossAmount.description: The loss incurred of the returned product shipping, used for accounting purposes.

shippingLossTaxAmount.description: The tax on the returned product shipping, used for accounting purposes.

totalWithoutWeightedShippingAndHandling.description: Taxable Subtotal including Weighted Order amounts

totalWithWeightedShippingAndHandling.description: Line item total with line item, Tax, Weighted Tax with Weighted shipping and handling costs

data.description: Custom data for a given vendor set within the commerce process.

id.description: Unique Identifier for this Return

customerAccountId.description: Unique identifier of the customer account.

visitId.description: Identifies the Visit ID that was current when the order was placed or when the cart was last updated.

webSessionId.description: Identifies the web session used to place the order or last update the cart.

customerInteractionType.description:
Determines the interaction type that a customer will use to create this object.
Valid values are: Website, Store, Call, Unknown

returnNumber.description: A human-facing identifier that is unique within a tenant to represent the sequential ordering of Returns.

locationCode.description: Location code where the return was made/processed

originalOrderId.description: The Id of the Order that this Return was generated from.

originalOrderNumber.description: The order number that this return was generated from.

returnOrderId.description: The Id of the Order that represents the items shipped to the shopper for this Return.

currencyCode.description: ISO Currency Code. Currently, only USD is supported.

status.description:
The Status of the Return.  Valid values are 
    Null, Created, ReturnAuthorized, ReturnPending, ReturnReceived, ReplacementShipped, Cancelled, and Closed.

receiveStatus.description:
A rollup status describing whether the return items have been received.
See Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.Return.ReceiveStatusConst for possible values.

refundStatus.description:
A rollup status describing whether the return items have been refunded.
See Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.Return.RefundStatusConst for possible values.

replaceStatus.description:
A rollup status describing whether the return items have been marked as replaced.
See Mozu.CommerceRuntime.Contracts.Returns.Return.ReplaceStatusConst for possible values.

items.description: The list of items being returned by the Shopper and replaced by the Merchant in this Return.

notes.description: Any Merchant Notes for this Return.

rmaDeadline.description: The deadline for a Shopper to ship the items in this Return to the Merchant.

returnType.description: Specifies whether this Return was a Refund or a Replace

refundAmount.description: If this Return was refunded,  how much was credited to the shopper? This amount is summed from the refund payments.

payments.description: Any Refund payments associated with this Return.

packages.description: Shipping package associated with this return.

productLossTotal.description:
The Total Loss Amount is equal to the (cost of item) * quantity of item returned.
It is meant to represent the product value to the merchant of the items damaged or returned by a shopper.

shippingLossTotal.description:
The Shipping Loss Total is equal to the (shipping cost of item) * quantity of item returned.
It is meant to represent the product value to the merchant of the items damaged or returned by a shopper.

lossTotal.description: Sum of the ProductLossTotal and the ShippingLossTotal.

productLossTaxTotal.description: The Total Taxes assessed on the product loss.

shippingLossTaxTotal.description: The Total Taxes assessed on the shipping loss.

userId.description: Unique identifier of the current user.

channelCode.description: Unique identifier of the channel for this item.

changeMessages.description: Change messages related to the return.

actionRequired.description: To find Returns that have failed to refund.

isUnified.description: Was this return created by the Unified platform.

canInitiateRefund.description: To identify Return is refundable or not.

refundToGC.description: If this Flag is true, Refund will be done on new Gift Card.

ReturnCollection.description:
Paged collection of returns. This is paged in case it's returning a long list of returns. 
for a store.

actionName.description: The name of the action to perform, query the Return for Available actions to get valid values. This is required.

returnIds.description: The list of Returns upon which to perform the action. This is required.

ReturnItemCollection.description: Collection of return items listed on the order.

id.description: Unique identifier of the wishlist line item. System-supplied and read-only.

comments.description: Comments for the wishlist item that are entered by the wishlist owner

priorityType.description: Wishlist item priority that is a hint to how much this item is needed or desired

WishlistItem.description: A single line item of an order.

customerAccountId.description: Unique identifier of the customer account.

typeTag.description: Open-ended Wishlist type, e.g. giftlist, gift, wish, wishlist, wedding, baby.  If the merchant does not need this level of granularity this is always null.

name.description: Name of the list that is display or potentially shared (e.g. friends and family may view this description if the list is public and the list owner may see this description when viewing the list)

items.description: List of items in the wishlist.

privacyType.description: Is the wishlist public, viewable only through a shared link, or private (only the owner of the list may view the wishlist)?

sortOrder.description: The wishlist sort order.  Useful for scenarios where there is a default wishlist and other wishlists or arbitrary ordering

isImport.description: Was this object imported from an external system?

externalId.description: Id in an external system this item may have been imported from

Wishlist.description: Details of the wishlist, items listed in the wishlist, and any system messages.

startDate.description: The beginning of the active date range of this document

endDate.description: The end of the active date range for this document

id.description: Read-only, system generated 32 digit alpha-numeric string that uniquely identifies the document.

name.description:
The fully qualified name of the document including path.
Unique within the documentList. This field is a required field, but it can be updated.

path.description: ReadOnly, path portion of the Name property.

publishSetCode.description: The name of the publish set that this document belongs to, if any.

extension.description: If applicable, the file extension associated with the document content.

documentTypeFQN.description:
The full name of the documentType that underlies this document.
This field must be supplied upon document creation and cannot be updated.

listFQN.description:
The fully qualified name of the documentList to which the document belongs.
This field is read-only and represents which documentList the document is created in.

contentLength.description:
The size of the content subresource in decimal number of OCTETs.
When updating the content subresource, the  contentLength is captured from the
Content-Length header, if present, or is otherwise computed from the total size of the http body.

contentMimeType.description:
The mime type of the document's binary content, provided via the Content-Type header when updating the content
subresource. If no value is provided then "application/octet-stream" is set by default.

contentUpdateDate.description:
The date and time the most recent content update was made via the content subresource. UTC date/time.
System-supplied and read-only.

publishState.description:
The current publish status of the document. If publishing is not supported or is currently disabled in the
documentList then the value will be "active".
If publishing is supported and enabled, then the publish state may be "draft" or "active". A document may have both
an "active" and "draft" version. The publishState
denotes which version of the document being interacted with. This field is read-only.

properties.description:
A JSON object of name/value pairs. Name parts are matched against the underlying documentType properties names. Any
matching name parts must have a value part that conforms to the matching property schema.
Any non-matching name/value pairs are considered dynamic schema and may have a value part of valid JSON.
The properties field can be used for sorting/filtering and can be projected in the documents returned within a
documentList view.

insertDate.description: The date and time the document was added to the documentList. This field is system-supplied and read-only.

updateDate.description:
The date and time the most recent document update was made. If publishing is enabled, then this value will
represent
the last draft update if the publishState is draft, or the last publish date if the publishState is active.

Document.description:
Container for schema-enforced and schemaless data. A document is primarily used to store content (html, text,
numbers, dates, JSON, binary data) that is directly or indirectly used for the storefront website experience
and may be addressed via the Hypr theming engine language. A document belongs to a documentList and has an
underlying documentType.  The documentType describes any required and optional schema. Additionally, a binary
object may be stored on the document's content subresource and edge cached via the Mozu CDN.

destinationPath.description: The destination path to copy documents to

name.description:
The name of the field projected into the view document, meaning the name given to the target field after it is projected.
The name must be unique within the list of viewFields provided in the view.

target.description:
Specifies the document field to project. First-class fields will be returned on the document, but can be projected into the view properties. 
Valid first-class fields include name, id, documentTypeFqn, listFqn and publishState. Dynamic fields within the properties field can be projected by prefixing the target string with "properties."
Example: "properties.property1". If a property is an object, then dot notation can be used to walk to particular subelements. Example: "properties.property1.subProperty1"
Individual array elements can be selected as well. Example: "properties.property1.subProperty1.subSubArray[2].propertyOnArrayItem"
Any target miss will result in a null value returning for the projected field.

ViewField.description: The projection of an individual field in a view.

name.description: A view is addressed via its name, which is unique within the documentList or documentListType in which it is defined.

metadata.description: The metadata field allows arbitrary data to be stored on the view.

isVisibleInStorefront.description:
The isVisibleInStorefront field indicates whether documents in the view can be accessed from the Mozu storefront application. If true, the storefront application and storefront client application (javascript tier) 
can GET documents from the view.

filter.description:
Filter criteria to apply automatically when documents from this view are accessed, using the standard Mozu filter syntax. Only documents matching the filter criteria will be returned. 
Any filter provided by an operation is combined with the view filter.

includeInactiveMode.description:
If view documents are requested with includeInactive=true, then this controls which documents return. If includeInactive is not provided or set to false, then only active documents return.
If not set, or set to "all", then all documents return.
If set to "active", then only documents within the active date range and documents with no active date range are returned.
If set to "scheduled", then only documents with an active date range in the future are returned.
If set to "activeOrScheduled", then only documents that are active or documents with an active date range in the future are returned.
If set to "ended", then only documents with an active date range in the past are returned.

fields.description: Designation of which document fields are returned (projection) when GETing documents from the view.

View.description:
A view provides GET access to documents within the documentList the view belongs to. The view can designate which document fields are returned (projection) and
a security model for providing GET access independent of the documentList's security model.

name.description:
The name component of the listFQN, name@namespace. The name must be unique within the namespace component and cannot be updated.
If the documentList is based on a documentListType, then this value will be derived from the documentListType.

namespace.description:
The namespace component of the listFQN, name@namespace. The issued dev account namespace must be used unless elevated privileges allow a blank namespace to be used. The namespace cannot be updated.
If the documentList is based on a documentListType, then this value will be derived from the documentListType.

listFQN.description:
The unique identifier of the documentList, represented by name@namespace. The listFQN must be provided when creating the documentList, or the name and namespace fields must be provided.
If the documentList is based on a documentListType, then this value will be derived from the documentListType.

documentTypes.description:
An array of the full names (name@namespace) of the documentTypes supported by the documentList. A document in the documentList must belong to one of these documentTypes.
If the documentList is based on a documentListType, then this value will be derived from the documentListType. DocumentTypes can be added/removed to the documentList, even when
based on a documentListType. Existing documents that belong to a documentType removed from the documentList will not be removed.

supportsPublishing.description:
Determines if the documentList will support drafting and publishing documents. 
This field defaults to false and cannot be updated.
If the documentList is based on a documentListType, then this value will be derived from the documentListType.

enablePublishing.description:
Determines if the documentList has publishing turned on or off. If the documentList has a supportsPublishing value of true, then the enablePublishing value will be honored.
If enablePublishing is true, then a document draft will be created for a document create or update operation. A document must then be published to become "active".
If enablePublish is false, then all document changes are immediately "active".
If enablePublish is true, then updating it to false will immediately publish all draft changes.
If the documentList is based on a documentListType, then this value will be derived from the documentListType, but can be overridden on update.

supportsActiveDateRanges.description:
Determines if the documentList will support ranges of dates that documents are considered 'active'. 
This field defaults to false and cannot be updated.
If the documentList is based on a documentListType, then this value will be derived from the documentListType.

enableActiveDateRanges.description:
Determines if the documentList has ActiveDateRanges turned on or off. If the documentList has a supportsActiveDateRanges value of true, then the enableActiveDateRanges value will be honored.
If enableActiveDateRanges is true, then a document will only be returned if the request is made within the time frame the document has been set to be 'active'.
If enableActiveDateRanges is false, then the properties can be set but will not be honored.
If enableActiveDateRanges is true, then updating it to false will immediately start honoring the previously-set date range.
If the documentList is based on a documentListType, then this value will be derived from the documentListType, but can be overridden on update.

views.description:
An array of one or more views, which each allow GET access to a projection of fields from the documents in the given documentList. 
If the documentList is based on a documentListType, then this value will be derived from the documentListType. Views can be added/removed to the documentList, even when
the documentList derives from a documentListType.

usages.description:
An array of strings that describes to the Mozu platform the manner(s) in which a documentList can be used. The following values are valid:
entitymanager -- the documentList should be visible in the Admin Content/Entities UI, which allows admin users to create, manage and publish documents within the documentList.
sitebuilder -- the documentList should be visible in Site Builder. A documentList will display in the Site Builder Navigation Content List node, which supports document creation, management and web cms integration.
If the documentList is based on a documentListType, then this value will be derived from the documentListType. Usages can be added or removed from the documentList, even when the documentList derives from a
documentListType.

scopeId.description:
Used in conjunction with the scopeType field to determine the exact context within which the documentList resides.
Example: A documentList with a scopeId of 5 and scopeType of masterCatalog belongs to masterCatalog 5.
If the documentList is based on a documentListType, then this value will be derived from the documentListType. This value is read-only after the documentList is created.

scopeType.description:
The context level the documentList resides in. Valid values are "tenant", "masterCatalog", "catalog" and "site". This field is used in conjunction with the scopeId field
to determine the exact context within which this documentList resides. This field is read-only after insert.
If the documentList is based on a documentListType, then this value will be derived from the documentListType. This value is read-only after the documentList is created.

documentListType.description:
The full name of the documentListType (name@namespace) that underlies the documentList. This value is only populated when the Mozu platform creates a documentList from a documentListType.
A documentList that is directly created cannot specify a documentListType. This field is therefore read-only.

metadata.description:
Allows arbitrary data to be stored on the documentList.
If the documentList is based on a documentListType, then this value will be derived from the documentListType, but can be overridden on update.

DocumentList.description:
A container for documents and related settings, such as supported documentTypes and publishing. 
A documentList belongs to a Mozu context, denoted by the documentList scopyeType and scopeId fields. 
Example: documentList A belongs to catalog 123, denoted by the documentList scopeType value of catalog and scopeId value of 123.
A documentList can only be accessed if the API context is inclusive of the documentList's scope.
Example: documentList A belongs to catalog 123. An API call with an API context of catalog 123 will be able to address documentList A.
Example: site 456 uses catalog 123. An API call with an API context of site 456 will be able to address documentList A.
Example: masterCatalog 789 is the parent of catalog 123. An API call with an API context of masterCatalog 789 will NOT be able to address documentList A.
Documents can be created, queried, managed and published from within a documentList. A documentList may be directly created, or indirectly created from a documentListType.

name.description: The name of the document to create.

documentTypeFQN.description: The full name of the documentType that underlies this document.

DocumentInstallation.description: The definition of a document to create when a documentList is created.

name.description:
The name component of the documentListTypeFQN, name@namespace. The name must be unique within the namespace component and cannot be updated.
Each documentList created from the documentListType will use this value.

namespace.description:
The namespace component of the documentListTypeFQN, name@namespace. The issued dev account namespace must be used unless elevated privileges allow a blank namespace to be used. The namespace cannot be updated.
Each documentList created from the documentListType will use this value.

documentListTypeFQN.description:
The unique identifier of the documentListType, represented by name@namespace. The documentListTypeFQN must be provided when creating the documentListType, or the name and namespace fields must be provided.
This field cannot be updated and each documentList created from the documentListType will use this value.

scopeType.description: The context level at which this documentListType will create documentLists. Valid values are "tenant", "masterCatalog", "catalog" and "site". This field is read-only after insert.

installationPackage.description:
Optionally, a documentListType can be defined in an installationPackage and then installed into a tenant. Installed documentListsTypes can only be updated via installation upgrades. 
Currently only internal Mozu platform components can create installations. This field is system-supplied and read-only.

version.description: The version of the installationPackge installed. This field is read-only.

defaultDocuments.description: The definition of any documents to create when a documentList is created.

documentTypeFQNs.description:
The full names (name@namespace) of the types of documents that can be created within the documentLists belonging to this documentListType. 
Each documentList created from the documentListType will use this value, but it can be overridden in an individual documentList.

supportsPublishing.description:
Determines if documentLists belonging to this documentListType will support drafting and publishing documents. 
This field defaults to false and cannot be updated. Each documentList created from the documentListType will use this value.

enablePublishing.description:
Determines if documentLists belonging to this documentListType have publishing turned on or off. 
Each documentList created from the documentListType will use this value, but it can be overridden in an individual documentList.

supportsActiveDateRanges.description:
Determines if documentLists belonging to this documentListType will support drafting and ActiveDateRanges documents. 
This field defaults to false and cannot be updated. Each documentList created from the documentListType will use this value.

enableActiveDateRanges.description:
Determines if documentLists belonging to this documentListType have ActiveDateRanges turned on or off. 
Each documentList created from the documentListType will use this value, but it can be overridden in an individual documentList.

views.description:
An array of one or more views, which each allow GET access to a projection of fields from the documents in the given documentList. 
Each documentList created from this documentListType will use this value, but it can be overridden in an individual documentList.

usages.description:
An array of strings that describes to the Mozu platform the manner(s) in which a documentList can be used. The following values are valid:
entitymanager -- the documentList should be visible in the Admin Content/Entities screen, which allows admin users to create, manage and publish documents within the documentList.
sitebuilder -- the documentList should be visible in Sitebuilder. A documentList will display in the Sitebuilder Navigation Content List node, which supports document creation, management and web cms integration.
Each documentList created from this documentListType will use this value, but it can be overridden in an individual documentList.

metadata.description:
Allows arbitrary data to be stored on the documentListType. Each documentList created from this documentListType will use this value, 
but it can be overridden in an individual documentList.

DocumentListType.description:
A documentListType instructs the Mozu platform to automatically create documentLists within a scopeType. Example: Creating a documentListType in tenant X with a 
scopeType of site tells the Mozu platform to immediately create a documentList in each site tenant X has. The Mozu platform will also automatically create a new 
documentList for every site subsequently provisioned in tenant X. Any defaultDocuments defined on the documentListType will be created within 
each documentList. Each documentList will be addressable via the documenetListType's fully qualified name and will, by default, use the documentListType's views, 
usages and metadata. Therefore the documentListType can be used to centrally manage each associated documentList.

id.description: The system generated 32 digit alpha-numeric string that uniquely identifies the document.

name.description: The unique name of the document.

documentTypeFQN.description: The full name of the documentType that underlies this document.

listFQN.description: The fully qualified name of the documentList to which the document belongs.

activeUpdateDate.description: The date and time the document was last published, if any.

draftUpdateDate.description: The date and time the document draft was last updated.

updatedBy.description: The userId or applicationId that last updated the draft document.

publishType.description:

installationPackage.description:
Optionally, a propertyType can be defined in an installationPackage and then installed into a tenant. Installed propertyTypes can only be updated via installation upgrades. 
Currently only internal Mozu platform components can create installations. This field is system-supplied and read-only.

version.description: The version of the installationPackge installed. This field is read-only.

dataType.description:
The underlying value type that can be held in the document's property value. Valid values are
string
number
boolean
datetime
json
The dataType is analogous to an intrinsic value type in object oriented programming, or to a column data type in relational database terminology.

PropertyType.description:
The schema a document property value must implement. A propertyType is created at a tenant scope and is therefore shared amongst all child contexts (masterCatalog, catalog, site).
A propertyType is analogous to the type argument of a class property in object oriented programming. 
A propertyType's dataType field is analogous to an intrinsic value type in object oriented programming, or to a column data type in relational database terminology.

name.description:
The name portion of the name/value pair stored on a document's properties field. The property name value must be unique within the properties defined on the documentType.
This value cannot be updated after property creation.

isRequired.description: True if the property must be present on the document. This value is false by default.

isMultiValued.description: True if the property value is an array, where each array value must conform to the propertyType. When false, the property value must directly conform to the propertyType. This value is false by default.

Property.description: A schema element describing a name/value pair that can be stored on a document's properties field, where the name is directly defined by the propertyName and the value is constrained by the propertyType.

name.description: The name component of the documentType, name@namespace. The name must be unique within the namespace component and cannot be updated.

namespace.description: The namespace component of the documentType, name@namespace. The issued dev account namespace must be used unless elevated privileges allow a blank namespace to be used. The namespace cannot be updated.

documentTypeFQN.description: The unique identifier of the documentType, represented by name@namespace. The documentTypeFQN must be provided when creating the documentType, or the name and namespace fields must be provided.

adminName.description: The administrative name of the documentType.

installationPackage.description:
Optionally, a documentType can be defined in an installationPackage and then installed into a tenant. Installed documentTypes can only be updated via installation upgrades.

version.description: The version of the installationPackge installed. This field is read-only.
